ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] I just want to let you know!!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: heres a short description. if you use any of the filtering options like others damage off, npc spells off, my misses or whatever you should use /serverfilter
ygData.messageBody:
heres a short description.

if you use any of the filtering options like others damage off, npc spells
off, my misses or whatever you should use /serverfilter on to prevent the
server from sending this data to your client. else this info gets propagated
over your (possibly very thin) wire and flood your pc with things that the
client itself discards as you choose to filter that info out. This helps ...
a lot in raid situations with 30+ people and low bandwidth users.

On the other hand, if youre on dsl or any other (relatively) highspeed
connection the file datarate.txt in your eq directory is set wrong. Its
tuned by verant for a modem user. What this file does is preventing the
server from overloading your client with too much data causing linkdeaths
when you can no longer recieve enough info, this tends to happen when zoning
or when someone uses a lag intensive spell (sentinel, ae rains and so on).
The Verant setting is 5.0 in the file. If youre on dsl turn this up to 9.0
(max)

This will reduce the lag you get by letting your client recieve more updates
since you have more bandwidth. this will make you much more responsive and
not having a nasty 30 secs msglag when someone is asking for a heal or a
buff or whatever.

More is in the manual or on the everquest messageboards at everquest.com.
Read the technical information.

/Ranina

-----Original Message-----
From: D. Scott Smith [mailto:scott@...]
Sent: Friday, May 03, 2002 3:14 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] I just want to let you know!!!!


Please direct me to where I can learn more about serverfilter and
datarate.txt modifications. That was a new one to me!

Paria 36 Necro

Tribunal

-----Original Message-----
From: alexander.jones@...
[mailto:alexander.jones@...]
Sent: Friday, May 03, 2002 2:34 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] I just want to let you know!!!!


you need to fiddle around with the user interface some to understand how it
works. Most things are reachable through /commands in the chat bar. try
/help and read some.

You also have a hot key bank, you need to assign skills to buttons and
probably you will want put the button in your hot-key bank. try to structure
it early into types of banks. Combat, traveling and so on. find a system
that suits you.

If you want to delve into the more advanced commands then maybe perhaps
affix sense heading to your slam button or something like that. This will
max out Sense heading very fast. Or filter out your hits out of the chatbox,
this gets annoying fast when you got double attack and dual wield. hard to
read things then.

There are many many things that makes the ui better, there is no set way of
whats good and bad just preference. IT also varies as yo pass through
levels.

If you like to raid a lot and are playing in large groups, remember
serverfilter is your friend and DONT forget to set your datarate.txt to
appropriate value. Your friends will love it even more than you not having
to wait for ld people all the time.

But I think you have some learning to do before this, keep it up.
Experiment, learn. dont just take it from everyone else.

/Ranina
